Farmer: Each night, you learn if a calamity is in play. You are immune to calamities.
Barkeep: Each day, you may pick a player. If they received information during the night, you learn what it was. That player is poisoned tonight.
Guard: Each night, learn if any evil players stood up that day.
Worry-Wort: Each night, you may learn something true. You do not know what it means until you die.
Blacksmith: Each night, pick a player. They may choose to kill someone who nominates them.
Astronomer: On night two, pick a player. They are no longer affected by calamities.
Mad Scientist: Each day, ask the storyteller a question. They will tell you one player who might know the answer. The storyteller may prompt you to ask a different question.
Villager: Each night, you learn if the alignment of one or both of your neighbors has changed.
Robber: Once per game, choose a player. You now have the same role, but are poisoned tomorrow night.
Maniac: If you are executed by nomination on the last day, your team wins.
Gardener: If you die, you know what killed you.
Priest: You start knowing if one or both of two players are good.
Stalker: Each night, pick a player. You learn if they were woken up in the night.
Village Chief: You start knowing how many outsiders there are.

Reverend: You believe you are the demon. You are not. You may register as evil.
Follower: Each night, pick a player. You believe anything they say. If you reveal who you followed, you might be executed.
Cursed Child: If you are executed, a calamity will occur during the night.
Nay-Sayer: You are mad that you are a townsfolk. You think all players are good and will always defend them. If you break madness, you might be executed.

Doombringer: Each night, choose a calamity you have not chosen before. This calamity may go into effect tomorrow night, lasting only one night, in secret.
Shapeshifter: Each night, pick a player. You also get their night information.
Gambler: You do not know who the demon is, and the demon doesn't know you exist. If you nominate the demon and they are executed, the evil team wins. If you execute a good player, the good team wins. You must announce who you are before nominating.
Backstabber: Once per game, if you are nominated but not executed, the nominee is executed immediately.

Werewolf: Each night choose a player. If their ability lets them choose a player, any good players chosen will die. Otherwise, they will die.
Zombie: Each night, pick a player, even if you are dead. They die. All evil players must die for good to win.
Mind Flayer: Each night, pick a player. Tomorrow, they are mad that they are evil. They will die tomorrow night. [-2 Minions, +2 Outsiders]
Plague: Each night, pick a player. If they are a townsfolk, they are now the Plague, and you have died.

info:
Calamities


Drunk Party - All good players receive faulty information.

Storm - Player information is skipped.

Mandela Effect - Player information is presented the same as the night before.

False Flag - One good player registers as evil to all abilities tonight.

Mob - A random player is on the chopping block. No one knows who.

Drought - If there are no nominations today, someone random will be executed.

Telephone - Information is given to the wrong players, but is otherwise true.


Speaking with the Storyteller does not count as speaking in private

* Not the First Night
